content.question:
The transport of a substance across a plasma membrane of a specific organelle requires energy. The rate at which the transport takes place also depends on temperature. A scientist isolated the specific organelle and then used the following treatments to determine the conditions that will result in the maximal transport. All treatments contained the extracted organelle and were maintained at <math alttext="25 degrees Celsius" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mtext>25</mtext><mi>°</mi><mtext>C</mtext></mrow></math>.

The data from this experiment indicate that maximal rate of transport of protein <math alttext="X" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>X</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> at <math alttext="25 degrees Celsius" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>25</mn><mi>°</mi><mtext>C</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> occurs at an <math alttext="A T P" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>ATP</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> concentration of <math alttext="1.0 micromole per milliliter" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1.0</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>μ</mi><mtext>m/mL</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>.

Figure 1. The four <math alttext="A T P" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mtext>ATP</mtext></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> concentrations used in the experiment

Which procedure should be done next to gather data needed to meet the scientist’s objective?

choices.label: Incubate samples with the same four <math alttext="A T P" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>ATP</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> concentrations at <math alttext="30 degrees Celsius" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>30</mn><mi>°</mi><mtext>C</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>.

Incubate samples containing <math alttext="5.0 micromoles per milliliter" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>5.0</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>μ</mi><mtext>m/mL</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> of <math alttext="A T P" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>ATP</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> at four temperatures other than <math alttext="25 degrees Celsius" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>25</mn><mi>°</mi><mtext>C</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>.

Incubate samples containing <math alttext="1.0 micromoles per milliliter" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1.0</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>μ</mi><mtext>m/mL</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> of <math alttext="A T P" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>ATP</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> at four temperatures other than <math alttext="25 degrees Celsius" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>25</mn><mi>°</mi><mtext>C</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>.

Incubate samples containing <math alttext="1.0 micromoles per milliliter" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1.0</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>μ</mi><mtext>m/mL</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> of <math alttext="A T P" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>ATP</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> at <math alttext="25 degrees Celsius" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>25</mn><mi>°</mi><mtext>C</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> and determine the rate of transport for four other proteins.

content.answer: Incubate samples containing <math alttext="1.0 micromoles per milliliter" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1.0</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>μ</mi><mtext>m/mL</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> of <math alttext="A T P" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>ATP</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> at four temperatures other than <math alttext="25 degrees Celsius" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>25</mn><mi>°</mi><mtext>C</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>.

skill.text: 3.D: Propose a new investigation based on an evaluation of the experimental design or evidence.
